data.chText: 保释金；保释
data.enText: money that sb agrees to pay if a person accused of a crime does not appear at their trial. When bail has been arranged, the accused person is allowed to go free until the trial.

data.chText: 有人保释你吗？
data.enText: Can anyone put up bail for you?

data.chText: 她以2 000英镑获得保释。
data.enText: She was released on £2 000 bail .

data.chText: 保释金定为100万元。
data.enText: Bail was set at $1 million.

data.chText: 他在具保候审期间又犯罪了。
data.enText: He committed another offence while he was out on bail (= after bail had been agreed) .

data.chText: 法官准予 / 不准保释。
data.enText: The judge granted/refused bail .

data.chText: 她弃保潜逃（未如期到庭受审）。
data.enText: She jumped/skipped bail (= did not appear at her trial) .

data.chText: 三柱门上的横木
data.enText: either of the two small pieces of wood on top of each set of three wooden posts (called stumps )
bale

data.chText: 允许保释（某人）
data.enText: to release sb on bail

data.chText: 他获得保释，定于3月15日到庭候审。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He was bailed to appear in court on 15 March.

data.chText: （尤指迅速地）离开
data.enText: to leave a place, especially quickly

data.chText: 对不起，我真得赶紧走了。
data.enText: Sorry, I really have to bail.

data.chText: 与…搭讪（常指对方不愿意）
data.enText: to approach sb and talk to them, often when they do not want this
bail out (of sth)

data.chText: （从即将坠毁的飞机中）跳伞
data.enText: to jump out of a plane that is going to crash

data.chText: 逃避，摆脱（不想再牵连其中的情况）
data.enText: to escape from a situation that you no longer want to be involved in

data.chText: 如果你想从这种关系中摆脱出来，我可以理解。
data.enText: I'd understand if you wanted to bail out of this relationship.
bail out
bail (sth)↔out

data.chText: （从…中）往外舀水
data.enText: to empty water from sth by lifting it out with your hand or a container

data.chText: 他不得不停止划船，把船里的水舀出去。
data.enText: He had to stop rowing to bail water out of the boat.

data.chText: 我们若不排水，船就要沉。
data.enText: The boat will sink unless we bail out.
bail sb↔out

data.chText: 保释（被告）
data.enText: to pay sb's bail for them
bail sb↔out (of sth)

data.chText: 帮助（某人）脱离困境
data.enText: to rescue sb from a difficult situation

data.chText: 政府只得帮助该公司渡过财政难关。
data.enText: The government had to bail the company out of financial difficulty.

data.chText: 瑞安在比赛后阶段得的一分拯救了他的球队。
data.enText: Ryan's late goal bailed out his team.

means: 与…搭讪(常指对方不愿意)

data.enText: bail out (of sth)

data.chText: （从即将坠毁的飞机中）跳伞
data.enText: to jump out of a plane that is going to crash

data.chText: 逃避，摆脱（不想再牵连其中的情况）
data.enText: to escape from a situation that you no longer want to be involved in

data.chText: 如果你想从这种关系中摆脱出来，我可以理解。
data.enText: I'd understand if you wanted to bail out of this relationship.
bail out

data.enText: to empty water from sth by lifting it out with your hand or a container

data.chText: 他不得不停止划船，把船里的水舀出去。
data.enText: He had to stop rowing to bail water out of the boat.

data.chText: 我们若不排水，船就要沉。
data.enText: The boat will sink unless we bail out.
bail sb↔out

data.chText: 保释（被告）
data.enText: to pay sb's bail for them
bail sb↔out (of sth)

data.chText: 帮助（某人）脱离困境
data.enText: to rescue sb from a difficult situation

data.chText: 政府只得帮助该公司渡过财政难关。
data.enText: The government had to bail the company out of financial difficulty.

data.chText: 瑞安在比赛后阶段得的一分拯救了他的球队。
data.enText: Ryan's late goal bailed out his team.

trans: （常指通过出资）帮助…脱离困境

tr: the legal system that allows an accused person to be temporarily released from custody (usually on condition that a sum of money guarantees their appearance at trial)
(criminal law) money that must be forfeited by the bondsman if an accused person fails to appear in court for trial
example: a $10,000 bond was furnished by an alderman

tr: remove (water) from a vessel with a container
secure the release of (someone) by providing security
deliver something in trust to somebody for a special purpose and for a limited period
release after a security has been paid

value.boxr_value: The spelling bale is also used for meaning 5, and for meanings 1 and 3 of the phrasal verb. 拼写bale亦用于义项5以及短语动词的义项1和3。

value.def: Bail is a sum of money that an arrested person or someone else puts forward as a guarantee that the arrested person will attend their trial in a law court. If the arrested person does not attend it, the money will be lost.

example.ex: He was freed on bail pending an appeal...
The high court set bail at $8,000.
example.tran: 高等法院将保释金定为8,000美元。

value.def: Bail is permission for an arrested person to be released after bail has been paid.

example.ex: He was yesterday given bail by South Yorkshire magistrates.
example.tran: 昨天南约克郡法院准予他获得保释。

value.def: If someone is bailed, they are released while they are waiting for their trial, after paying an amount of money to the court.

example.ex: He was bailed for probation reports...
example.tran: 他因等待鉴定报告而获得保释。

example.ex: He was bailed to appear before local magistrates on 5 November.
example.tran: 他获得保释，将于11月5日在地方法庭出庭受审。

value.def: In cricket, the bails are the two small pieces of wood that are laid across the top of the stumps to form the wicket.
value.tran: （板球运动中）三柱门上的横木

value.def: If you bail, you use a container to remove water from a boat or from a place which is flooded.

example.ex: We kept her afloat for a couple of hours by bailing frantically.
example.tran: 我们拼命往外舀水，使它继续漂浮了几个小时。

example.ex: A crew was sent down the shaft to close it off and bail out all the water...
example.tran: 一组人员被派下矿井将其封闭并把水舀干。

example.ex: The flood waters have receded since then, but residents are still bailing out.
example.tran: 此后洪水已经开始消退，但居民还在往外舀水。

value.def: If a prisoner jumps bail, he or she does not come back for his or her trial after being released on bail.

example.ex: He had jumped bail last year while being tried on drug charges.
example.tran: 去年他在因涉毒被控告期间弃保潜逃。

value.tran: （囚犯）在保释期间逃跑，弃保潜逃

trans: （常指通过出资）帮助…脱离困境
